Yes, Clemson University does promote the use of organic farming practices in South Carolina through several initiatives. The Sustainable Agriculture Program at Clemson's Coastal Research and Education Center offers educational programs and research on organic and sustainable agriculture practices. The program focuses on providing farmers with practical guidance and resources to transition to organic farming and to comply with organic certification standards.

Clemson Extension's Sustainable Agriculture program also provides educational resources on organic farming practices such as cover crops, crop rotation, and biological pest control. Clemson also hosts an annual Organic Certification workshop, where farmers can learn about the federal regulations for organic production and get help with the application process.

Besides, Clemson University's Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences offers a degree program in Organic Agriculture, which provides students with a comprehensive understanding of organic production methods.

Overall, Clemson University is committed to promoting organic farming practices in South Carolina as part of its mission to advance sustainable agriculture and environmental stewardship.
